messages.message:
1. There is no backup. To add a back up, we’d have to add another payment processor. And I don’t think we are going to do that. However, I did suggest to Victor that we do the Stripe set up in the background so that doesn’t block any user facing actions. Currently, if Stripe is down users cannot create an org.
2. There is one and only one endpoint for Stripe (api.stripe.com) and there is one and only endpoint for Metronome (api.metronome.com). We do not have control over these endpoints.
3. We cannot change either endpoint; see #2. We can, however, disable both Stripe and Metronome by clearing their API key environment variables. Maybe that’s what you mean…? Bit confused about this question.

The uber goal is to prevent an incident when one of our third-party dependencies goes down. Looks like we dont have backups for these endpoints.

Metronome is handled with queues and we have an action item to make Stripe non-blocking. Does that sound about right ?
Does disabling Stripe make it non-blocking ?
